fields.name: shortcode
fields.label: Enter a Shortcode for costs to be billed to

fields.name: billingAuthority
fields.label: Billing Authority
fields.attributes: (('yes', 'I confirm I have approval from an individual with the authority to use the shortcode.'),)

fields.name: serviceLvlAgreement
fields.label: Service Level Agreement
fields.attributes: (('yes', 'I have read the Sensitive Data Guide, agree that my use of this service complies with those guidelines and accept the terns of the Service Level Agreement.'),)

fields.name: name
fields.label: Enter a Directory Name
fields.description: This is the name of your storage volume (alphanumeric, 3 - 25 characters, no special characters allowed), which will appear after the share has been mounted on your machine
fields.help_text: The default value can be modified to your specifications.

fields.name: size
fields.label: Size
fields.description: Size in whole integer in terabytes of useable space.

fields.name: flux
fields.label: Flux & Great Lakes
fields.description: Checking this box indicates you would like this storage to be available to the Great Lakes cluster
fields.help_text: Permits mounts to all hosts on the ARC-TS Flux and Great Lakes clusters. These networks are 141.211.19.0/27, 141.211.22.192/27, 10.164.0.0/21, 10.224.72.0/21, 141.211.192.32/27, 10.164.8.0/21, 10.164.24.0/21
fields.attributes: (('yes', 'Make this storage available to Flux & Great Lakes?',),)

fields.name: uid
fields.label: Numeric User ID
fields.description: Provide the UID of the user account that will administer the top level of the share. This cannot be 0 because root access is squashed. Use chown, chmod, and groups to provide access to the rest of the space.
fields.help_text: The User ID (or UID) is a string of numbers that are used to identify individuals for the storage system. This is different than your eight-digit U-M ID number. An individual can find his/her UID by using the online directory. The default value in this field is the UID of the requestor.

fields.name: owner
fields.label: Provide a MCommunity group
fields.description: Members of this group can make changes to the service, and we’ll contact the group with any service-related information. The member list for this group must be publicly visible.
fields.help_text: The MCommunity Group Name is the title of the group as it appears in its mailing address. For example, if your group address is group@umich.edu, 'group' is the appropriate value for this field.

fields.name: permittedHosts
fields.label: Permitted Hosts
fields.description: Provide the address of each permitted host on the wired U-M network. If forward and reverse records exist in DNS, use the fully qualified hostname. If the records do not exist in DNS, provide the IP address.

fields.name: owner
fields.label: Provide a MCommunity Group Name
fields.description: Members of the group can make changes to the service, and we'll contact the group with any service-related information. Member list for this group must be publicly visible.
fields.help_text: The MCommunity Group Name is the title of the group as it appears in its mailing address. For example, if your group address is group@umich.edu, "group" is the appropriate value for this field.

fields.name: ad_group
fields.label: Enter the UMROOT Active Directory Group Name
fields.description: This is  the name of the AD (Active Directory) Group that will be granted access to the storage. Any member of this group will be then able to access the share, and any member of the group can also grant access to others.

fields.name: name
fields.label: Enter a network share name
fields.description: The name of the network share created. Please note that the full share name will begin with the department prefix, followed by a dash, then the root share name (example: PRE-SHARENAME). If you are not sure of your department's prefix, please contact your local IT support staff.

fields.name: size
fields.label: Size
fields.description: Size in whole integer in terabytes of useable space.

fields.name: totalCost
fields.label: Total Cost
fields.description: Your monthly charge: $~

fields.name: multi_protocol
fields.label: Multiprotocol
fields.description: Allow CIFS access to be added to NFS volume
fields.help_text: Checking this box allows CIFS access to be added to the NFS volume.

fields.name: sensitive_regulated
fields.label: Regulated and/or Sensitive
fields.description: Potential for use with regulated or sensitive data. Including but not limited to HIPAA, PHI or ITAR.
fields.attributes: (('yessen','Yes, Will be used now or in the future with regulated and/or sensitive data. (HIPAA, PHI, ITAR, etc)'),('nosen', 'No, Will not be used with regulated and/or sensitive data.'))

fields.name: nfs_group_id
fields.label: Group ID
fields.description: Provide the MCommunity group name or GID of the group that will access the share using NFS.
fields.help_text: If multiprotocol is selected, the MCommunity and CIFS UMROOT AD group names should match, if possible.

fields.name: sensitive_regulated
fields.label: Regulated and/or Sensitive
fields.help_text: Potential for use with regulated or sensitive data. Including but not limited to HIPAA, PHI or ITAR.
fields.attributes: (('yessen','Yes, Will be used now or in the future with regulated and/or sensitive data. (HIPAA, PHI, ITAR, etc)'),('nosen', 'No, Will not be used with regulated and/or sensitive data.'))

fields.name: nonHipaaOptions
fields.label: Make available to the following services:
fields.help_text: These choices are for storage without sensitive or regulated data.

fields.name: hipaaOptions
fields.label: Make available to the following services
fields.help_text: These choices are for storage with sensitive or regulated data.

fields.name: turboADgroup
fields.label: CIFS UMROOT AD Group Name
fields.help_text: This is the name of the AD (Active Directory) Group that will be granted access to the storage. Any member of this group will then be able to access the share, and any member of the group can also grant access to others.
